name: hash
description: Converts a string into a fixed length hexadecimal string.

params.name: algorithm
params.description: A supported algorithm such as MD5,SHA,SHA-256,SHA-384, or SHA-512. Of those listed SHA-512 is the strongest and generates a 128 character hex result. CF7+

params.name: encoding
params.description:
A string specifying the encoding to use when converting
 the string to byte data used by the hash algorithm.
 Must be a character encoding name recognized by the
 Java runtime. CF7+

params.name: iterations
params.description: Iterates the number of times the hash is computed to create a more computationally intensive hash. Lucee and Adobe CF implement this differently (off by one), see compatibility notes below. CF10+

coldfusion.notes: CF7 added additional algorithm support, CF10 added the iterations option.

lucee.notes: The iterations value represents the total number of hashes on Lucee, in Adobe CF the value is the number of additional iterations.

examples.title: MD5 Hash Example
examples.description: MD5 is not recommended for use requiring security.
